Pre-Game Insights: Die Mannschaft will now mostly focus on the younger core with the likes of Florian Wirtz and Jamal Musiala leading the new generation.
Hungary have built a reputation of being one of the stubborn sides who on their day can take on any opponent.
Marco Rossiâ€™s side will be aiming to bounce back after enduring a disappointing run in the recently concluded Euro 2024.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kai Havertz has impressed everyone with his performances in the number nine role despite not being a traditional nine.
Dominik Szoboszlai has emerged as an important member of this national team and now plays with more responsibility and maturity.
Germany are unbeaten in their last six home games.
Hungary have scored just six goals in their last five matches.
Germany secured a 2-0 win over Hungary when they faced each other last time.
Others: The kick-off is scheduled for Saturday, 7 September 2024 at 7:45 PM UK.
The match will be telecast in India on Sony Sports Network, SonyLIV.
Injury & Team News: Germany are moving into a new era with plenty of senior players stepping down from international duty.
Hungary will rely on the shoulders of Dominik Szoboszlai to provide the goals after handing him the captaincy role full-time.
